noteR.para: To prevent any risk of triggering the pyrotechnic systems (pretensioners or airbags), the use of a multimeter or any other electrical measuring device on these elements is prohibited.
Risk of serious burns or electric shocks that may prove fatal.
It is strictly forbidden to repair Orange High-Voltage connectors and wiring.

DANGER : Risk of serious injuries due to the short-circuiting or the untimely triggering of an electrical system (pyrotechnical parts, windscreen wiper motor, electric fan, etc.) following possible loopback of the 12-volt supply circuit by the voltage transformer.
Please adhere to the instructions regarding cut-off of the 12-volt supply circuit.

If the procedure fails, do not continue with your task and ask an employee who is qualified and authorised to work on a high-voltage onboard network to perform fault finding vehicle : precautions for the repairGIEMR-002446.

descsection.para: Remove the lockout of the 12 V supply circuit 12 V supply circuit : lockout - removal of lockoutGIEMR-000508.

descbody.para: Do not leave any unused + 12V connectors exposed to the air without any protection (see Connector: Sealing and locking) (Technical Note 6015A, Wiring).
Check that there is no contact between the wiring and the fuel and brake pipes.
Avoid mounting the wiring in areas with a temperature above 100°C.

description.title: advice to be followed before any operation

descbody.para: Before carrying out any work on the + 12V supply circuit wiring, disconnect the + 12V battery.

noteR.para: To avoid all risk of damage to the systems, apply the safety and cleanliness instructions and operation recommendations before carrying out any repairs:

ul.li: wiring : precautions for the repairGIEMR-000748 (NT 6015A, 88A, Wiring),
12 V battery : precautions for the repairGIEMR-000251,

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To prevent any malfunction of the electronic systems, do not damage the locking systems of the connectors.
reusenote.para: To prevent any malfunction of the electronic systems, do not damage the locking systems of the connectors.

noteR.para: To prevent any damage to the connectors, consult the disconnection procedures (see Connectors: disconnection and reconnection) (Technical Note 6015A, 88A, Wiring).

Before fitting wiring with a higher equipment level than the original, to prevent noise in the passenger compartment consult the procedures on locking the connectors (see Connector: Sealing and locking) (Technical Note 6015A, Wiring).
To prevent any risk of malfunction (noise, premature wear, short circuits, etc.), mark the wiring routing and how to connect the connectors.

description.title: instructions to be followed during the operation

noteR.para: To prevent contamination of disconnected connectors and sockets, hermetically seal the connectors and sockets using a plastic bag and a securing clip. For traction battery sockets, use traction battery caps vehicle : parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To prevent any damage to the wiring during removal, ensure that the wiring is released from its mountings (retaining clip, plastic clip, adhesive tape, connector, etc.).
reusenote.para: To prevent any damage to the wiring during removal, ensure that the wiring is released from its mountings (retaining clip, plastic clip, adhesive tape, connector, etc.).

descbody.para: To prevent the wiring from being damaged, check that the surrounding area is not mechanically harmful (e.g. door windows, sharp corners, burrs, studs, etc.).
The wiring should be positioned at least 30 mm away from any moving components (belt, pulley, steering column, etc.).
Depending on the surrounding area, check that the unused connectors comply with the necessary sealing constraints (see Connector: Sealing and locking) (Technical Note 6015A, Wiring).
All of the connections (connectors) used in the engine compartment are sealed; do not remove the seal from around the connectors.

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To prevent damage to the wiring harness when refitting, observe the original routing.
reusenote.para: To prevent damage to the wiring harness when refitting, observe the original routing.

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To avoid any bad electrical connection, make sure that the wiring does not place any stress on the connectors or the surrounding components.
reusenote.para: To avoid any bad electrical connection, make sure that the wiring does not place any stress on the connectors or the surrounding components.

reusenote.dyndoctitle: To avoid any damage to the wiring, observe the correct orientation of the battery terminal.
reusenote.para: To avoid any damage to the wiring, observe the correct orientation of the battery terminal.

descbody.para: To prevent water flowing into the connectors, when possible make a low point on the wiring routing (just before the connector).
For connections between fixed and mobile components, secure the wiring on the fixed part.
Overlapping of the battery feed wires (positive and negative) causes disruption; they must be secured separately.

ul.li: DO NOT connect an earth to a stud with insulating protection (paint, etc.),
DO NOT use more than two earth terminals on the same point,
DO NOT use power earths on the same point as electronic earths.
use plastic clips, ensuring that the color coding is respected,
DO NOT use steel clips that are not protected with rubber,
keep the clips attached to the wiring during a replacement operation,
DO NOT leave steering wheel wires without protection.
the connectors are correctly housed and locked,
when it is visible it must be aesthetically pleasing, and resemble the routing marked during removal,
prevent the wiring from routing in grooves and overlaps (risk of wear through friction),
prohibit mounting several wires on the same clip,
DO NOT lock the connectors or wiring in areas that are subject to drilling (i.e. the number plate area).
